page.title: 06OTTERTON MILL (II)
page.content: About 4,00 tickets are sold every year and about 19,000 people just come to look around the shops! Admission is Â£1 for grown ups and 50p for children. There are about 10 craftsmen altogether making pottery and woodcarving .They work in the out houses at the back of the Mill. She employs one person all the year round, Ian Crowther, and she employs 7-8 people in the season. The restaurant is the thing that brings in the most money. The food they make is all wholemeal food. People that visit the Mill either come because they are interested in water power or because they put on exhibitions. Others like the cooking. They have 5 doves, 20-40 hens and loads of fish in the stream.
